## PopulatedRedemptionInterface.increaseAmountByMinimumNetDebt() method

Prepare a new transaction by increasing the attempted amount to the next lowest redeemable value.

**Signature:**

```typescript
increaseAmountByMinimumNetDebt(maxRedemptionRate?: Decimalish): Promise<PopulatedRedemptionInterface<P, S, R>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

maxRedemptionRate


</td><td>

[Decimalish](./lib-base.decimalish.md)


</td><td>

Maximum acceptable [redemption rate](./lib-base.fees.redemptionrate.md) to use in the new transaction.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

Promise&lt;[PopulatedRedemptionInterface](./lib-base.populatedredemptioninterface.md)<!-- -->&lt;P, S, R&gt;&gt;

## Remarks

If `maxRedemptionRate` is omitted, the original transaction's `maxRedemptionRate` is reused unless that was also omitted, in which case the current redemption rate (based on the increased amount) plus 0.1% is used as maximum acceptable rate.
